recipe_name: Cranachan with raspberries, whisky and cream
author: Brian Turner
method: Gently heat the sugar in a frying pan until golden and completely melted. Add the oats and stir well, then pour the mixture onto a non-stick baking sheet and leave to cool. When completely cooled, break into small pieces. Place the whipped cream, cream cheese, yoghurt, icing sugar and whisky into a bowl and mix well, then fold in the chocolate. To serve, place half of the caramelised oats into the bottom of a serving glass. Top with half of the cream mixture, then half the raspberries. Repeat the layering with the remaining oats, cream mixture and raspberries and garnish with a sprig of mint.
ingredients: 3 tbsp soft brown sugar,  75g/2½oz porridge oats,  250ml/9fl oz double cream, whipped until soft peaks form when the whisk is removed,  75g/2½oz cream cheese,  1 tbsp plain yoghurt,  1 tbsp icing sugar,  dash whisky,  50g/1¾oz dark chocolate, chopped,  30g/1oz fresh raspberries,  sprig fresh mint, to garnish
